text: Dark brown color, small brown head. Aromas of peat, bitter dried fruits, wood, spices, cognac and caramel with slight tart hints. Taste of whisky, peat, tart dark fruits, wood, smoked meat, bitter honey and slight resin. Much more whisky flavors than its younger siblings.

Dégustée à température de 14 à 17,5°C. Corps épais de couleur noir; mousse beige foncé, assez peu importante pais persistante. Délicieux parfums de fruits confits, café, pruneau, figue, alcool, Christmas cake, pain de seigle, réglisse, whisky. Saveurs identiques avec en plus la tourbe. Très riche en arômes et saveurs mais pas lourde du tout : une certaine légèreté, le grillé ne prend pas le dessus, lamertume est fine, juste structurante. Légère acidité qui affine la finale. Une gourmandise subtile. Lalcool fait son effet mais nest pas envahissant pour les papilles. Très agréable en fin de dîner.
Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma smoke - phenolic, dried fruits, toffee. Loads of sweet toffee, smoke, barrel, dried fruits .

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Bottle 330 ml from an Amazon order. Aromas of coffee, caramel, smoke. Small brown-beige head and black body (amazing color if you hold it up against a light!). Sweet and smoky but very intense taste with coffee and salt caramel.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, klarowny.
Piana: średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: wyraźne aromaty beczki, whisky, wyczuwalne również aromaty ciemnych, suszonych owoców, ciemnych słodów, kawy, czekolady, trochę ciemnego pieczywa.
Smak: lekka pełnia, sporo nut beczki, whisky, trochę torfowej wędzonki, ciemnych słodów, czekolady, kakao, delikatne nuty ciemnych owoców, delikatna kwaskowość, goryczka w kierunku średniej.
Wysycenie: średnie.
Very dark brown with thin head. Aroma is intense with boozy, peat smoked whiskey. Flavour has cocoa, ash, peat, leather. Just a hint of chocolate. Very intense.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2017 Pours dark brown, almost black with tan beige head with good lacing. Aroma: roasted grain, malts, smoked, dark fruit esters, sweet vanilla, cocoa & whisky. Flavour follows aroma: roasted grain, smoked, malts with coffee, milk chocolate, cacao like character, dark fruit esters, vanilla, leather, tobacco, whisky. Dry, astringent finish. Medium body, soft texture, moderate carbonation.

Pours thin black with decent tan head. Aromas of coffee, molasses, oak, hint of chocolate and a vague wisp of smoke. Medium carbonation and light to medium mouth feel. Taste is Raisins, coffee, molasses, hint of oak and some peat phenols. Medium sweet with moderate bitterness. This is like Brewdog paradox islay on a diet. The flavour is there but its not big and bold enough
Ahumado de whisky intenso, chocolate, toffee y fruto seco. Cuerpo medio y regusto ahumado.

Appearance: Bottled 2/2016. Very dark brown. Slight light tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, barrel. Oak.
Taste: Dark malt, strong barrel, slight smoke. Nice, but a little bit one-dimensional.
Bought: Beers of Europe, 330 ml, £5.19
Info: 24/3-2017, BB: 28/2-2019

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Black with small beige. Aroma is smoke, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is smoke, tobacco, leather, and some chocolate.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 Pours black. Aroma of roasted malt, port, caramel. Taste is smoke, dry roast cofee, slight sourness. Enjoyable

330ml bottle from Melbourne Street Cellars pours deep black with very slow forming off-white head. Savoury aromas of wood, earth, smoke and dark berries. Caramel malt, whisky, smoke, charred wood, soy, leather and a hint of cherry sourness. Fantastic layering of flavours although the texturally a bit thin.
Bottle. Black, tiny bubbly tan head. Aroma coffee, marzipan, wood, hints of smoke. Smooth velvety texture, low carbonation, medium body. Sweet taste bringing out the whisky tones.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, toffee, whiskey
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium sourness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall- very good

Incredibly delicious aroma of whiskey. Sagolik taste of coffee easily and light chocolate. But much oak and whiskey. Celestial good bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. The best of both worlds in a beer? Whiskey + beer = World Class. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Robe noire, opaque, dense, fine mousse. Nez puissant sur le malt, des notes iodées, du chocolat noir, une touche fumée, grand complexité, évolue vers les fruits secs, les raisins des Corinthe, la figue. Bouche à lattaque ample et complexe, rétro fumée, bulle fine, trame amère et fumée, longueur impressionnante et finale serrée. Une bière impressionnante de longueur et de complexité.
Could be a nice beer but the oak drowns out the other flavors. Too much oak, disappointed.

Pours virtually black from the bottle. The head has a thin, creamy underlayer beneath a foamy surface, but soon fades to whispy remains amid light lacing. Notable up front is the strong berry aroma. Behind it lingers noticeable smoke and a bit of wood. The taste starts lightly tart, and finishes extremely well with a complex mix of smoke, barrel, and red berry. The body is medium, surprisingly light given the range of flavor. Very good stuff. Best drunken without food to enjoy the subtle range of delights.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

pours black in color as expected with a nice soft off-white head. Chocolate, charred wood, caramel, a bit of sweet/burnt BBQ. Fairly thin and soft-bodied. Chocolate roast with a touch of that burnt BBQ meat and smoke character, likely off the scotch, a nice and different complexity.

Notes: September 2014 bottle(#09161) from Total Wine, opened in Jan 17.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Wygląd: Ciemno brunatne z przebłyskami, piana bez rewelacji, zostają jakieś plamki na szkle.
Aromat: Na początku czuć wkład beczek, później dochodzi wędzona śliwka, lekkie praliny czekoladowe.
Smak: Kwaskowe, śliwka fest, poza tym jak wyżej. Mogłoby być ciut gęstsze.
Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma is smokey, spicy, prunes and treacle. Lovely smokey, peaty flavour with hints of stewed plums and raisins. Velvety smooth.

From bottle at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a dark brown clear with a tiny off white head. Aroma has toffee, tobacco, light smoke, lots of oak, sweet licorice, light port wine. taste is sweet, oaky, light bitter, light smoke, pretty spicy. Body is medium full and the carbonation is rather low.

330 ml. bottled April 2013. Aroma is soy, cocoa, whiskey, char, oak and a hint of smoke. Wow the taste is the same complex mix plus more smoke and bacon. Medium-heavy body is smooth with low-medium carbonation and an excellent balance.

Bottle from de Caigny, bottle No 00931 dated Feb 2016, 33 cl sample. Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma has a lot of peat, some roast and a bit of dark choc and coffee. Roasty bitterness in taste together with some dry peaty smoke and a hint of sweet toffee. Great balance, good complexity, which makes this a wonderful brew.

On hand pump at Archive. Appearance of black oil as the name suggests. Aroma of chocolate and whiskey that carry through to the palate. Ive had this from the bottle before but the hand pump offers an even smoother experience
W aromacie mocna słodka suszona śliwka. W smaku kwaskowe,wytrawne, palone, gorzka czekolada, cieprkie na finiszu. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.

Prawie czarne z przeciętną pianą. W aromacie czekolada, toffi, nuty dębowe, wyraźna wanilia, lekki kokos, whisky. Półwytrawne, smak złożony, ponownie skojarzenia z whisky, trochę torfu, dąb, lekka czekolada, wanilia już nie tak wyraźna. Minimalnie kwaśne. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty. Bardzo smukłe, niestety mało treściwe, rzadkie.

Piwo barwy ciemnobrązowej, ze skromną pianką. W aromacie suszone owoce, mleczna czekolada, wanilia. Od razu po przelaniu czułem nuty whiskey, ale po chwili ten aromat się ulotnił. W smaku paloność, kawa słodzona, suszone owoce, delikatna czekolada, piwo jest również lekko kwaśne. Bardzo słabo wyczuwalne nuty whiskey, ale są. Piwo pije się lekko i przyjemnie.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 Bottle from Brewers Haven. Looking like, and smelling like, an imperial stout. Aroma is woody, boozy, earthy. Beautiful heady smells. Taste comes in mildly sweet, roasty, molasses, pit fruit, woody. Chewy mouth feel, warmth from the alcohol. An already great brew made better with the right choice of barrel aging.
Bottle from the importer. great whisky job with this barrels. nice vanilla and caramel flavors.
Pretty complex. Roast and good malt. Some light cask but very well balanced overall. Some tobacco and leather like a biker bar. Dark brown pour with good head and lacing. Bottle.

Une vraie bière à cigare. Le whiskey est super présent, il apporte une noblesse et un cachet vraiment unique. Un sacré côté fumé, très boisé et tabac derrière qui est troublant.
Au nez, on va surtout ressentir le whiskey et le fumé. Pas mal éthylique également, presque agressif.
La bouche a une super attaque ronde, noble, sirupeuse et part ensuite sur un whiskey et un fumé très particulier, un peu écoeurant, mais franchement bien balancé et riche.
Jolie expérience.

Bottle at home. Pours black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, whiskey and cocoa. Taste has strong smoked whiskey notes, overall roastiness, coffee, cocoa and oak. Some bitterness. Not your average one but quite nice.

Black huebwith a thin sticky tan head. Amazing fruity nose of berries and plums and raisins but also peaty scotch. Reeeally tasty fruit forward flavor thats got plum and raisin and fig and berries but also has a woody gentle scotchiness thats warming and smokey malty at the end of the palate. Very interesting and tasty. Fruity than I thought it would be, but with a pleasant subtle sourness and gentle oak and scotch whispers.
Bottle from online shop. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, peat, oak, whisky and toffee. Bitter finish with roasted malts, toffee, oak, whisky and nuts. Very nice brew.

Bottle. 
Dark, black color. Rich aroma: wood, oak, whisky, coffee, toffee. Taste: sweet, oak, caramel, raisins. Suprisingly easy to drink. Enjoyable.

Aroma; dark roasted malts, peat, sour prune, oak, dark fruit peels n vanilla. Look; beige low head, black body. Taste; dark roasted malts, liquorice, oak, black prune, dark caramel, milk - dark caramel liquorice malted sweet-wooden finish. Feel; solid body, soft. Overall; tasty sipper. Bottled Feb 2016, exp date - Feb 2019.

Poured from bottle to a snifter

Aroma: roasted malts, peat, dark chocolate, a little bit of butterscotch and plums in the background

Pours with thin, rocky and minimal beige head. Dark brown colour (seems almost black, but its not), hazy.

Quite full, medium to heavy medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Dark chocolate and peat.

Full bodied, definitely. Oily and sticky, quite thick. Soft carbonation, almost completely flat. Very long finish.

Interesting is the fact that in spite it was produced 9 months ago, there were noticeable features of oxidation already, especially raisins and dried plum.

If I had one more bottle, Id surely cellar it for 4-5 years.

A very good sipper. Delicious!

A very rich beer. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel. Almost impenetrable black colour. White head a bit frothy. aroma is dominated by the malt with a bit if vanilla and chocolate. Taste is very rich and complex at the beginning toffee and chocolate slightly sweet progressing towards more a bitter coffee after taste. A great beer.

Appearance: completely black, beautiful fine creamy foam. Aroma: intense, complex. Chocolate, roasted notes, a nice sweet vanilla. Dominated, however, notes of whiskey - a lot of peat. Taste: clearly feel the vanilla and peat. Slightly sour aftertaste. Beer rather dry, as for me missing here body.

dark brown, small head
chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and sour from whisky/bourbon yeast,soft carbonation, medium body ... tasty
Bottle - aroma is dominated by the malt with a bit if vanilla and chocolate. Taste is rich toffee sweet up front, then a sliw transition to a dry roast malt choc finish. Rich palate.

Bottle. Lots of oak and whiskey notes, some roastiness and malty sweetness. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture and bit watery, slightly acidic and warming finish. Really tasty, great whiskey flavour.
Bottle at tasting event. Pours thick, deep, dark brown. Aroma and flavor are roasted barley, whiskey, oak, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, coffee, and dark fruit. Full body.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Ola Dubh Special Reserve 18 8% (bottle) by Harviestoun Brewery at MordorSporo kokosa, drewna, mniej stouta i ciala niz 16tka, posmaki kwaskowate, dosc wytrawny, bdb, ale dla mnie 16 wyraznie lepszy. butla z Feb 2016Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Dark porter appearance with small brown head. Black coffee and toffee flavours with some smoke and whiskey notes. Rich and creamy texture with a touch of warming alcohol feel. Long malt finish.

Butelka. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana średniej wysokości, beżowa, kremowa. To co odróżnia od wersji -12 i 16 letnią jest zdecydowanie piana. Aromat przyjemny, po przelaniu mało intensywny ale po chwili można wyczuć nutę tytoniu, popiołu i subtelną nutę torfową. Smak w zupełności oddaje to co dzieje się w aromacie. Przoduje nuta popiołu. Bardzo mocna, intensywna. Na dalszym planie torf, delikatne ciemne owoce. Wysycenie niskie do średniego. Piwo jest pełne, gładkie, smaki niezalegające. Wyczuwalny delikatny szlachetny alkohol. W aftertaste pojawia się nuta kwaśna, mało przyjemna. Na całe szczęście bardzo szybko ulatuje. Bardzo przyjemne, do powolnej degustacji. Wartym uwagi jest fakt, jak wersja bazowa piwa zmienia się pod wpływem leżakowania w poszczególnych beczkach. Piwa bardzo różnią się od siebie wpływem beczki i posmakami, które oferują.

330ml bottle No. 07614 kindly shared by LupuLust, merci and welcome to RB! - Bref: liquorice, mild peat and old leather lay an earthy umami blanket over this subtly aged ale full of raisin, plum, older dark berry, salty toffee and nuts flavours of a Scottish plumcake. - Mouthfeel is much lighter and smoother than anticipated, nearly sessionable, all but "viscous" compared to many an ImpStout, naturally carbonated. Whispy tobacco smoke enters late, lifting the aged fruit sweetness even more into a sepia picture of candied figs and whisky-like dry caramel/cane sugars. Well-aged, if a bit underwhelming considering its selling and marketing point. Still a few subtle and convincing notches above instant-IKEA-barreling Innis&Gunn.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Accidently taken from Manufactum Munich.
Shared at Bierhandlung 14.09.2016

Light brown head and a body almost as black and muddy as real old engine oil but actually not that viscous.
Smell is like toffe and nuts, bit like old leather with a hint of smoke from the whisky.
Medium not too heavy oily/creamy mouthfeel with a soft carbonation and a long lasting sweet finish with a taste of smoke on the palate as it pours down your throat.
Taste of nuts, sweet malt/toffe and the old wood.

Too expensive to call this one "süffig" but despite of the warm weather it was well drinkable and a joy.

Bottled September 2014.

Great looking pitch black brew with an ample amount of tannish foam.

Big caramel malt smell bordering on notes of butterscotch. .in other words, oxidation. Some dark fruit.

Tastes of caramel and oxidation. Butterscotch is there and will probably grow as time goes by. Some dark fruit hints. Whiskey seems to be playing second fiddle. Some, most English Old Ales/Barleywines with a heaping helping of oxidation, I dig. In this one, not so much.

High end of medium bodied, low carbonation.

It is not as bad as I may have portrayed it in what I said above. I will say that I have no desire to drink it again. I appreciate the smaller bottle presentation.

330ml bottle shared with brother, thanks for the share. Aroma: strong licorice, bourbon, raisin. App: dark brown, almost black, minimal mocha head, little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, liquoreux, medium sweetness, soft to moderate carbonation, subtle dry acidity finish. Overall: like it. Not overly sweet which is good. Whisky is not too present as well. Well balanced. Body could be bigger but its not doubt because of the barrel aging. Would drink again maybe not at this price tough. A bit too expensive.
A weak aroma of malt, pours a dark brown color with no head. A great taste of chocolate, and a hint of sweet malt. Lighter body with a sweet chocolate finish.

Un tonaca di frate molto scuro con schiuma marroncina sottile. Aroma intenso di whisky, cioccolato, una nota fumosa netta. Bevuta sorprendente per piacevolezza e facilità. Corpo quasi acquoso, leggera, malto con sottile sentore tostato. Vaniglia e liquirizia di retrogusto. Alcol ben presente ma che non appesantisce la bevuta. Invecchiatura in botte di whisky che aggiunge un tocco perfetto.

Bottle. Deep brown (almost black) and a whisper of a head with a slight rubiness to its dark chestnut. Nose of chocolate and whisky, like a liqueur chocolate. Taste is chocolate, some cream, a honeycomb toffee, a touch of coffee.... pow, theres some whisky when you work it. I get raisins and some lovely sweetness and some smoke. A sipper, but bloody tasty.
Rewelacyjne piwo. Zajebiste w smaku, świetne z wyglądu i przyjemne w aromacie. Udane piwo w każdym calu.

Donkerzwart bier met kleine beige schuimkraag.
Aroma: whisky, rokerig, zoetig.
Smaak: whiskytoets, beetje zout, 
Mondgevoel is eerder licht met fijn koolzuur en rokerige afdronk.

Piwo leżakowane przez 6 miesięcy w dokładnie wcześniej wyselekcojonowanych dębowych beczkach po 18-letniej Single Malt Whisky z destylarni Highland Park.  
 Kolor: Black Engine Oil - jak najbardziej trafne określenie w tym przypadku. Trunek czarny jak gęsty olej silnikowy. 
 Piana: Beżowo-kremowa, bardzo ładna, wysoka. Wyśmienicie barwi ścianki szkła, pozostawiając na nich masę wstążek.
Pokaźny krążek wisi wysoko nad piwem.
Po zakręcieniu szkłem piana otacza całą jego powierzchnię. 
 Zapach:  Arcyprzyjemny aromat! Nie mogłem wprost nosa oderwać od butelki.
Zapach jest złożony i bardzo wyraźny. 
Wysoko nad butelką unosi się woń szlachetnego alkoholu. Nikt nie ma najmniejszych wątpliwości z jakim alkoholem mamy tutaj do czynienia. Intensywna słodycz ciemnych owoców, toffi, ciemnych winogron. Dalej delikatne migdały, karmel i może szczypta wanilii.
W tle wyraźna torfowa nutka. 
Jestem ukontentowany w 100%-ach! 
 Smak:  W smaku pierwszymi nutami, które mnie zainteresowały były nuty wędzonej śliwki. Dopiero po chwili dołączyła do nich słodycz winogron, rodzynek, toffi i karmelu.
Akcenty dębowej beczki raz po raz dają o sobie znać dając posmaki drewna, dębiny i orzechów migdałowych.
Niezwykle intensywana jest także wędzona, a dalej za nią i torfowa strona piwa.
Goryczka jest dość widoczna z wyrażnym wędzonym posmakiem na ostatniej prostej.
Małe zastrzeżenie mam do tekstury piwa. Nie jest ona należycie gęsta, taka jakiej bym się spodziewał. 
Alkohol natomiast jest pięknie wpleciony w środek. Nie dominuje, jest dobrze ułożony i fajnie pobudza.
Bardzo dobry, degustacyjny trunek. Jedno z najlepszych Old Ale na świecie. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Opakowanie:  Jedno z najładniejszych opakowań. Od razu z daleka produkt wydaje się ekskluzywny, z wyższej półki. Ładna, wyraźna kolorystyka. Sreberko i doczepiona karteczka z dodatkowymi informacjami o poszczególnych Single Maltach, jak i o samym piwie.
Pod spodem - kapselek firmowy do kolekcji (miłe zaskoczenie, bo spodziewałem się golasa). 
 Podsumowanie:  

Ola Dubh (lub "Balck Oil" - "Czarny Olej") jest piwem, którego nazwa wywodzi się właśnie z jego tekstury i lepkości. O dziwo, w tej właśnie jednej kwestii miałem jedynie tutaj zastrzeżenie. Nie twierdzę, że piwo jest wodnistę, ale skoro nazwa jest taka jak jest, to spodziewałem się gęstości jak w topowych RIS-ach.

Cała reszta jak najbardziej przypadła mi do gustu. Aromat jest przepiękny, intensywny, złożony. Ma wiele do zaoferowania: od ciemnych owoców, toffi, migdałów, winogron, przez nuty karmelu i wanilii, a na torfowych niuansach skończywszy.
Do smaku należy dorzucić rodzynki i przede wszystkim intensywnie wyczuwalne śliwki.
Posmaki szlachetnego alkoholu - Single Malt Whisky badzo dobrze komponują się z całością.
Wyborne piwo nie tylko dla amatorów whisky.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Black with dark brown head. Aroma: vanilla, hay, caramel, licorice, leather, wood, soy sauce, after heating up also cherry esters. Body is medium, medium to light sweetness. Malty body with rasted finish. Lots of woody notes especially in aftertaste. Same as in aroma, after heating, appears cherries.

Bottle no 06903, March 2014. L703. BB March 2017. Pours darkish brown with a steady, smallish in size, beige head that leaves some scattered lace. The aroma is rather subdued whisky, sweetish and kinda smoky. Tastes likewise with a slight salty hint but otherwise sweet. Very fine if any carbonation barely slices through the somewhat sticky but lightish body. IDK I dont think its much different (or better for that matter) than the 12 YO version. What I am certain of is that I seem to have overrated the 16 YO (gave it a whopping 4.2), or alternatively, that was just so much better, which I kinda suspect is not the case as I had that 2 years ago when I hadnt had many BA brews... That said, I really dont think this one (or the 12) is bad - not at all! Its well balanced, without aggressive or ballsy or plain stupid edginess, its round and well drinkable with the whisky rather in the background (as opposed to the massive boozefests of some of the more modern and cool breweries BA brews). But overall TBH Im still a bit disappointed.

33cl-fles bij Billies Bier Kafétaria te Antwerpen U: zwart bier met bruine schuimkraag G: whisky, beetje geturfd en pure chocolade. Had gehoopt op een meer uitgesproken geur. S: zoete aanzet met een klein beetje geturfde whisky. Tegenvallend, mist wat mout/koffiebitterheid voor mij. Smaken waarschijnlijk ook wat afgebroken door het teveel aan carbonatie.

330ml bottle. Quasi black colour with small to average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Dark malty aroma with a nuttily touch, hints of toffee, a woody touch, some vanilla, a smoky touch, cautious fruity overtones of red berries, plum, cherry, some leather. Taste is dry, nuttily and chocolately dark malty, hints of leather, wood, a touch of toffee, vanilla, mild smokiness, a touch of liquorice; lasting dry finish, slightly sticky palate. Rich and variegated, but not complicated.

Brown bottle, 330ml. Pours black as coffee with a thin brown head subsiding average fast. Scent is surprisingly minimal of almost purely whiskey scents. Taste is medium dense whiskey cask. Resin. Oak maybe or other hard wood. Cedar? Rosemary. Coffee and toffee both. Caramel. Surprisingly also slightly sour. Mouth feel is medium Carmel. Excellent.

Bottle from LeeAVFC cheers mate; dark brown pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has sweet chocolate, dark fruits and some fudge, taste has roast malts, rich chocolate, dark fruits, some smoke, a hint of liquorice, ok.

Black color with brown head. Aroma has peated scotch and dried plums. Taste starts very balanced with peat, dark roasted malts, smoked ham, dried plums and figs. Not sweet but not too bitter either. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall its a really complex yet easy drinking ale.

Piękna brązowa, drobnopęcherzykowa piana. Piękny lacing. Kolor ciemnobrązowy. W aromacie wędzoność, suszona śliwka, słodowość, marcepan i whisky. Wszystko wyraziste i ładnie sie komponuje. Czuć pełnię w ustach Wysycenie średnie. W smaku  goryczka słaba, śliwki, mocno wyczuwalne  whisky, kawa i to wszystko okraszone nutami beczkowymi, czuć tą taninę. Alkohol świetnie ukryty ale rozgrzewa w ciele. Dzięki beczce otrzymało to piwo piękne ułożenie. Wszystkie smaki i aromaty świetnie sie komponują. Pyszne!

Clear, dark brown to black colored, small beige to tan head, only a ring remains. Aroma is of malt, chocolate, smoke-peat, whisky oak barrel, some roasted notes. from Mondial de la Bière 2013, Mulhouse - black beer with a poor head retention; gently woody whisky aroma with notes of black cherries and roasted chocolates; sweet malt backbone and full-bodied, creamy yet thick palate; light umami, some late bitterness and grainy notes; long chocolaty and woody notes in the finish

330 ml bottle into snifter, bottled in 10/2014. Pours opaque dark brown/black color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, toasted dark bread, whiskey, oak, peat smoke, leather, tobacco, light nuttiness/char, light vanilla, and oak/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and scotch barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big chocolate, cocoa, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, toasted dark bread, whiskey, oak, peat smoke, leather, tobacco, light nuttiness/char, light vanilla, and oak/toasted earthiness. Light-medium roasted bitterness and whiskey/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, toasted dark bread, whiskey, oak, peat smoke, leather, tobacco, light nuttiness/char, light vanilla, and oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and scotch barrel flavors with a great malt/bitter/oak spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from roast bitterness and oak spiciness as well. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy/bready, and fairly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding old ale style. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and soctch barrel flavors; and very smooth and easy to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Pitch black-body with a tiny, short-lived, medium brown head that disappears almost completely, but the viscous-looking pour and the lovely colour saves the Appearance. Extraordinarily inviting, sweet, malty and very strong aroma of massive chocolate: dark chocolate, bitter chocolate and chocolate sauce. The beer doesnt try to hide the fact that it has been aged in whisky barrels: I get lots of lovely notes of gentle whisky, without much peat. Also vanilla, and an overall vinous feel, even with some hints of port. Finally I pick up notes that remind me of lactic sugar, in a milk stout way? Strong flavour of chocolate, dark caramel, gentle whisky, dark dried fruits and a bit too much alcohol. In the back the sweet vanilla further increases the complexity of this brew. The taste is moderate sweet and moderate bitter. The mouthfeel is actually a bit of a letdown, it beer feels far thinner than it looks, and the texture is less oily than expected. In lack of a better word Id call it a bit watery... The finish is light dry, and the carbonation is soft. A brilliant beer with an amazing aroma and wonderful flavour, but a bit too alcoholic for such a "low" ABV beer, and I would have wanted a fuller body and a thicker and more oily texture.

Poured from a 2012 vintage 330 mL bottle courtesy of Gunnar. Aroma is moderately roasty with some light chocolate notes. Quite a bit of cask character with some medium light oak character and moderate peat notes. Some fruit notes of raisins and prunes. Aroma definitely highlights the cask whiskey character. Pours a motor oil black with a small, moderately thick, light mocha head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it linger a bit. Almost no lacing with moderately long legs. Flavor is slightly sweet with a moderate roast and light chocolate character. Some medium light dark fruit notes of prune, plum and raisin with hints of berry and cherry. Again, quite a bit of cask character that adds a bit of sweetness. Moderate whiskey and peat smoke notes. Medium bitterness without any hop flavors. Mouthfeel is medium full bodied and rather silky with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, an interesting stout that really allows you to understand the aroma and flavor of the spirits that the beer was aged in. The whiskey character is not overpowering, but definitely the highlight of the beer. The base beer is not as thick as I was expecting but its aroma and flavor contribute character while still allowing the whiskey notes to shine in an inoffensive way.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2014 Christmas day Ola Dubh tasting. Bottle number 13164 bottled in February 2012 Black beer with residual head. Aroma of wood, soy sauce, coffee, whisky, chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, dark treacle, soy sauce, oak, whisky and bitter coffee. Medium bodied and oily. Excellent stuff, a big step up from the 12 and 16.

text:
How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a very small tan head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, whiskey, wood, dried fruit, caramel.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Rather smokey, roasted malt, alcohol, whiskey, dried fruit, liquorice.

Pours a deep burnt umber color with a half finger of khaki foam. The nose is more subdued than expected with light sweet caramel, toasted chocolate malt and a bit of nuttiness. The palate follows the nose with a bit of flat cola, roasted chocolate and vanilla and caramel syrup sweetness. The lingering flavors have a touch of licorice herbalness and light whisky barrel character.

Bottle from Au Grain Dorge - Black color, persistent creamy beige head, decent lacing - Whisky, vinous, licorice, roasted malt, vanilla, oak, coffee and earthy hops aroma - roasted malt, licorice, whisky and oak flavor - Medium body, dry, medium bitterness, long roasted malt dry bitter finish - disappointing, lack of residual sugar and sweetness, too dry, but good whisky and malt balance

Drank this after the 12 year old cask finish and it was noticeably better. More whisky in the aroma to balance the chocolate sweetness. Great beer, this is the highest score I have ever given on rate beer. That said I am a big fan of Old Engine Oil on which it is based.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tiny tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour is vanilla, whiskey, roasted malt, liquorice, peat, and chocolate  with a bitter finish.

Finally found the missing one of these brews (years) in the States, at Total Wine in Summerlin, Vegas. Bottle No. 10023 on FEB 2012. Pours a dark brown colour with a frothy-bubbly mocha head, good retention and thick creamy lacing. Big nutty aromas with lots of dark fruits, but I do not feels the smokiness in this one. Well, at least not much. More molasses and hints of fruitcake. A little warming in the mouthfeel with a nice touch of dryness from the hops. Still, too wet overall. Taste is little mild compared to the nose, but still lots going on, with the blend of dark fruits, nuts and hoppy finish. Glad I could try this, but thats good for this one.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Will have to try the 12, 16, and 18 side by each to determine, as my memory isnt good enough to properly distinguish. There are so many things about this beer that make me happy. Firstly, a traditional scots beer from a real scots brewery aged in a kickass distillerys whisky casks. Secondly, the flavour is just so intricate and awesome. Bottle 341ml. 8%. Rich dark brown-black pour with a weak white head that bubbles away quickly, no lacing. Aroma is earthy - presence of toasted barley, chocolate, coffee grounds, mild peaty smokiness.Mouthfeel is clean, low carbonation, medium alcohol warmth. Taste is a depth of chocolately, nutty roast malts, tinge of peat smoke, and tremendous character from the wood of the whisky casks - vanilla, oaky. A tremendous brew worthy of high praise.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a fine and dense tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and whisky. Taste is like the aroma but also with notes of fruits, caramel, vanilla and a hint of licorice and peat. Has a smoky whisky aftertaste. Pretty full bodied for an 8% beer. Low carbonation. Its called an "old ale" but this is really a porter. And a good one too. The whisky flavour makes it a real sipper. I like it.

Toffee and chocolate roast notes on the nose, no hop aroma. Appearance is black with a thin tan head. Bottle 33cl. Small brown head disappearing. Opaque color. Aroma of oak, mozartkugel, gunsmoked whiskey and roasted malt. Taste is still malt and whiskey with a fugdy touch, but taste is not as powerful as either expected or aromawise.

Bottle from October 2012. Pours thick black with lovely brown, oily and fizzy head that dissipates quickly. Nose is coffee, molasses, dark fruits, vanilla. Much the same in the mouth, some small hint of the booze which surprised me as I didnt remember that from the previous occasions Ive had this beer. Very molasses, a little nutty. Heavy and slick, with that Orcadian smokiness coming through on the finish. Developed a cold overnight after drinking this so my taste and smell were probably compromised when I had this. Should try again as my memory was of a much better beer than this tasting.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with a small beige head which slowly disappears. Nose has superb balance with chocolate and sultana undertones. The peat gradually coming out more and more. Very nice. Light cocoa in the taste, followed by dried fruits - sultana, raisin, prune. A touch nutty, focusing on walnuts. Peat shines through until the end. Booze never hinting. Very well integrated between the beer and barrel. A very good brew

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 0,33 l bottle ? 11277 feb. 2012. True black oil with brown foam, deep and powerful aroma: wine, wood, vanilla,chocolate, almond, caramel, smoke. Complex taste: light sweet with smoked whiskey, vanilla, almond and toffee, pleasant bitterness. Great old ale.

From a 33cl bottle no. 02288 dated Sept 2012. Pours a black color with a small beige head that only leave a ring around the glass, with some lacing. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee, spices, hops, with a pleasant liquor whisky finish. Light carbonation, medium body, but nice balance of flavors with a strong chocolate finish. Very enjoyable.

330ml bottle, one year old this month. Pours very dark brown, slight red on the edges, small tan head, went away quick. Peat and a hint of chocolate aromas. Taste is more complex and intense. Peat, smoke, whisky, some chocolate and vanilla. Full, creamy body. Overall, this had that big beer feel to it, definitely an experience but still drinkable.
Beautiful deep aroma, rich peaty flavour with hints of cherry, brown sugar and coffee. Wonderful beer.

Aroma: Peaty malt with chocolate overtones.

Appearance: Pours a toffee black, with no head.

Taste: Sweet chocolate, toffee coffee, alcohol. Very peaty.

Palate: Flat and smooth. Silky. A little tingle that lingers on the palate. Long peaty finish.

Overall: 16/20, good beer, but too much peat for my taste. Great for scotch lovers though.

Bottle. Dark mahogany. Soft oaky, murky, nose. Dried beef jerky, smoke. Full bodied, smooth soft, even oily. A slight hint of vanilla, murky oak, tar. Lots of flavours, but not as impressive as I was hoping it to be. Overall seems like a liquid version of a roasted old murky rotten piece of wood.

Pours black with a brown tint and no head. Aroma is coffee, tar, muscovado sugar, honey. Taste is espresso coffee, vanilla, tar, honey, muscovado sugar. Just great!

This is something special. Its a beer you have to set up to drink, you cant take this to a party, unless its a beer tasting affair, its not a session beer, it is for the thinking beer drinker. 33cl, Bottle N°05243, at 8%Vol, exclusive Scottish brew, thx to KingCecil!, complex Porter, roasted/woody and slightly smoked/malty, yet not too heavy, balanced, clear, good head, very good brew

Pours an oil black pour with a thin light brown bubbly head. Smell is nutty chocolate with a bit of a boozy touch. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, and some smokiness. Definitely a nice bite in the back, not a ton of whisky flavor, but its interlaced in there providing a nice backbone.

Pours a deep opaque brown with just a hint of ruby highlight. A thin tan head with good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and sweet caramel along with some chocolate and oak. Taste mirrors the aroma with scotch and peat flavors melding with the roast, chocolate, caramel sweetness and some vanilla from the oak. Mouthfeel is silky smooth and full bodied with medium carbonation. Complex and very well blended flavors. Excellent and cant wait to try it again.

Amazing aroma based in molasses and treacle with spicy notes pepper and cardamon. Flavour accentuates the treacle note but adds a balancing bitterness with gentle roasty notes

Feb 2012 bottle. Pours pitch black with a small foamy head that quickly fades. Really great aroma of chocolate fudge, nuts, light smoke, caramel, light whiskey, light roasted coffee, vanilla, and pitted fruit. Taste is not as great as the aroma but still very good. The whiskey just shows up barely in the finish with some nuttiness. I really like the complexity of these Ola Dubh beers. I have my same complaint as the others Ive tried, the body is just a little too thin. But I guess thats why this is an old ale and not an imperial stout. Overall a fantastic brew. Wonderful Old Ale flavors and aroma. Wonderful in every aspect. Truly a world class Old Ale.

The taste is a nice harmony of beer and scotch, especially as it warms. Vanilla, dark bitter chocolate and that boozey smoke taste.

Great, finely balanced flavour with licorice, smoke, dark chocolate, wood and honey. Overall, the most balanced of the first three versions, but not the most impressive.

roast and whisky aroma,  clear black with frothy head.   slight sweet taste,  low bitterness. soft carbonation,  a light aftertaste of whisky.

text: Bottle from verksgata. Dark brown to black with a chocolate brown head. Aroma is vanilla and dark roasted malty. Smooth whiskey, wooden, light vanilla. Dry and roasted porter finish.

Appearance:
Dark and smoky  liquid charcoal and burnt wood. A thin head fades quickly, leaving behind a tight crema hued collar with a thin free-floating puddle also crema hued. Swirls with tan spots.

Nose:
Meaty dark fruits in the middle  figs and prunes. Chocolate dust, espresso crema, and dark caramel nougat along the edges. Oily tobacco leaf on top. Chestnuts roasting over an open fire then dipped in dark chocolate before eating. Black root and vanilla root weave in and out. Subtle smoke and bacon fat, campfire smoke and leather.

Palate:
Medium weight and super soft front to middle while the back is dry, parching, and thirst inducing. Sweet meaty smoke with bacon and leather oil. Hint of salt/brine in the very back of swallow. Spicy ABV heat. Tar sneaks in and out. Plums and cherries in the breath. Fine chocolate truffle powder and fudge along the edges.

Final Thoughts:
An exquisite beer to say the least. Dark, decadent, smooth, soothing, warming, and dare I say, Islay inspired. Whether intentional or not, the salt/bring essence was a particularly nice touch. The Ola Dubh series from Harviestoun is liquid bliss and well worth the greenbacks spent to enjoy them, the 18 year included.

medium sweet

Warm swallow, high bitterness, ever present dark malts, finish with dark chocolate, fruit and alcohol, with a lasting roasty aftertaste.

Black with a brown head - roasted malt aroma - roasted malt body with some bitterness - lingering finish with roasted malt bitterness - this was good

Black with a modest tan head.that hangs around well.  Aroma of nut oil, smoke, blackberries, vanilla, chocolate, a breath of alcohol - like all the variants, smells fabulous and pretty much endlessly intriguing. Oily mouthfeel (duh), very low carbonation. Bittersweet chocolate, dark berries, smoke, lots of nuts, treacle, soy sauce. Another very good beer, but another one I like less than ordinary Old Engine Oil - the beers a bit overtaken by all those nuts.

Aroma is on licorice, prune, raisin, metallic and wood notes, nice chocolate body. finish is on caramel and vanilla, very nice. Anyway we feel the beer is quite oxydated, some metallic and dry figs are there.

The flavor is smooth earthy roasted grains, a little touch of fruit, and the whiskey oak. One of those that hits the spot, don?t want to spend all day thinking about, just enjoying it.

Excellent, I love how these old ales are similar to the imperial stouts but replacing the roast with nut. So so smooth. Whiskey gave it some peat and ash notes, adding to it and not covering everything else. Chocolate tar, slight alcohol warmth, wood. Love the viscosity.

Mmmmmmmmm... thats easy drinking stuff. Earth, peat, chocolate, tons of smoke, and a bitter, bitter finish. Is that apple?? probably not. This drinks to fast. Some vanilla, dry, toast. Color: Very nice dark color, with a small dark head . 
Smells: Bacon, coffee and chocolate. 
Taste: Bacon, whisky, coffee, drop and caramel

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a smallish beige head, which lasts fairly well and leaves reasonable lacing. Scotch whisky characteristics are very pronounced in the aroma, with plenty of subtle smoke and nutty sweetness, as well as a powerful maritime aroma. Sweet, dark malt aromas are also noticeable, bringing in some toffee and praline notes. Faint herbal and citrus hops up front lead into a savoury, smoky flavour, with a touch of maritime tang coming into the mix. A smooth praline flavour gives it some body, with a nutty flavour and more smoke leading in to a warming finish. I am quite a fan of whisky cask matured ale, and this one is a fine example indeed. The sweeter, mellow characteristics of mature Scotch whisky blend very nicely with a dark, sweet ale to create a very fine brew.

Bottle from Slowbeer. Great, very rich. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, cask, smoke, and alcohol. Taste is sweet, with very long length. Palate is syrupy, and full bodied. Very dark brown, with a thin head.

330ml bottle produced one year ago. Dark with an initial topping of brown head that recedes quite quickly to zero. Lovely aroma featuring big, buttery toffee notes along with molasses, peat, smoke, whisky barrel and dark fruit. Sadly I didnt think the taste quite lived up to that benchmark. Its very dark and malty with lingering charred wood notes but seemed to lack the depth and complexity of the aroma. Nice and viscous on the tongue as advertised. This is pretty great beer but I wish I could taste the 30 and 40 year editions.

Whole Foods, Bowery 11.2oz ($11): Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, whiskey, but actually in a subdued and controlled way, and no booze. Taste is somewhat sweet. It is a bit chocolatey and somewhat nutty. Some hoppy bitterness manifests itself towards the finish. Really smooth. A wee bit smoky. Nice aftertaste. Surprisingly mellow in some ways.

Bottled July 2011.  Again, like the 12 and 16-year, the 18-year pours a deep brown with the appearance of motor oil.  Thick body, but no head.  Smoky, peaty aroma.  Smooth, with some initial sweetness, but, surprisingly, with more hops at the finish than the 16-year. I actually preferred the 16-year to this one, but the 18-year is excellent, too.  Just not sure its worth the price difference.

Pours pitch black with little head. Aroma is burnt malts with faint whiskey notes and lots of oak from the cask. Mouthfeel  is nice and medium thick. Flavour of wood and coffee, bit of whiskey and alcohol well hidden. This is a wonderful ale, loved it!

33 cl. bottle @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. Lighter shade of black, dark mocha head, mainly on the side. Pours black with a 1 finger, creamy brown head that has o.k. retention and leaves a little lacing, the beer itself . I think I preferthe 12 year as something to drink critically, but for a nice beer to chill out with - especially on a chilly night, I think the 18 year would be the one for me.

Original rating on September 2nd 2012: Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 5/5; Taste: 8/10; Palate: 5/5; Overall: 16/20
(33 cl bottle from Vinlageret Fanø; Bottle #11408; Bottled in July 2011) Pours black with medium, toffee head. Impressive lacework. Aroma is whisky with notes of peat and a hint of roasted malt.
